title: Parkland Father Stages Protest on Construction Crane on Fourth Anniversary of School Shooting
sub_head: Manuel Oliver has been calling for stronger gun-control laws since his son and 16 others were killed at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in 2018
body:
The father of one of the students killed at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Fla., climbed atop a construction crane in Washington, D.C., to demand action on gun violence.
Manuel Oliver, whose son Joaquin Oliver was killed in the 2018 school shooting, recorded a video from the top of the crane and posted it to Twitter. A banner that featured his sonâ€™s image and criticized the Biden administration for gun deaths also hung from the construction crane.
